title: Commission Regulation (EC) No 1281/1999 of 18 June 1999 laying down detailed rules implementing the entry price arrangements for grape juice and musts
header:
COMMISSION REGULATION (EC) No 1281/1999
of 18 June 1999
laying down detailed rules implementing the entry price arrangements for grape juice and musts
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body: This Regulation lays down the rules of application of the entry price arrangements for products falling within CN codes 2009 60 and 2204 30, listed in Annex I, Part 3, Section I, Annex 2, to the Customs Tariff of the European Communities.
The actual import price for the products referred to in Article 1 shall be verified by checking every consignment.

For the purposes of this Regulation "consignment" means the goods presented under a declaration of release for free circulation. Each declaration may cover only goods of one and the same origin falling within a single combined nomenclature code.

1. The import price on the basis of which the products referred to in Article 1 are classed in the Common Customs Tariff must be equal to the fob price of those products in their country of origin plus the cost of insurance and transport to the place of entry to the Community customs territory.
2. Where the import price cannot be determined on the basis of paragraph 1 of this Article, the products referred to in Article 1 shall be classed in the Common Customs Tariff on the basis of the customs value determined in accordance with the provisions of Articles 30 and 31 of Council Regulation (EEC) No 2913/92(3).

This Regulation shall enter into force on 1 July 1999.
This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 18 June 1999.
For the Commission
Franz FISCHLER
